item.description:
A HISTORY OF THE ARCTIC

Nature, Exploration and Exploitation

 

Author talk and booksigning with John McCannon

SATURDAY, JANUARY 26, 2:00 pm

:: :: ::


Polar historian John McCannon provides an engaging overview of the arctic region since the Stone Age, chronicling the history of indigenous populations, polar explorations, territorial conflicts, industry, and the profound changes the region is witnessing as a result of natural resource depletion and large-scale glacial melting. Regular Museum admission rates apply. Free for HMNH members. 
 
The Harvard Museum of Natural History presents engaging lectures and programs to excite the public about natural history. Their lectures and programs are open to the public and held at 26 Oxford Street, Cambridge.
item.name: HISTORY OF THE ARCTIC
